You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Offer a Discount on a Product When Purchasing Any Product with a Specific Spec Value

Create a coupon that discounts a buyer's entitled price for a specific product. But, the coupon is valid only when the buyer purchases another product with a specific spec value for full price. For example, offer 15% off a ceramic coffee grinder, but only when the buyer also purchases a product where the Roast spec is Medium.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create a coupon for buy-one-product-with-spec, get-one-product discount:	

Create on CC Coupons

AND

Create on CC Price Modifiers

AND

Create on CC Rules

AND

Create on CC Rule Source Specs

AND

Create on CC Rule Target SKUs

IMPORTANT This type of coupon strictly enforces Target Quantity and Source Spec Minimum Quantity values, and doesn't automatically apply to multiples of those quantities. For example, the following steps describe how to create a coupon where:
The cart must include a quantity of one of a target product
The cart must include a quantity of one of a product with the source spec value
The buyer receives a discount on a quantity of only one for the target product

What happens when the cart contains a quantity of more than one for both the target product and product with the source spec value? The discount still applies to a quantity of only one for the target product. The coupon's criteria don't scale as quantities change. And, because B2B Commerce allows a buyer to apply only one coupon per cart, the buyer can't apply the same coupon twice. To allow a buyer to receive a discount on a quantity of two target products, create another coupon where Target Quantity is 2.

On the CC Coupons tab in your org, click New.
Enter the coupon details that are visible to your buyers on the storefront.
For Coupon Name, enter a name for the coupon record, such as 15CERAMIC.
For Coupon Code, enter the code that you want a buyer to enter on the Shopping Cart page, such as 15CERAMIC.
For Start Date and End Date, specify the range of dates that you want the coupon to be available for.
Enter the discount details.
For Rule Type, select General.
For Discount Type, enter Percentage.
For Discount Amount, enter a value, such as 15.
TIP By default, the field displays the value as currency—for example, $15.00. But when Discount Type is Percentage, B2B Commerce evaluates the value as a percentage, as in 15% discount.
Scroll to the Coupon Target section, and specify the product that the discount applies to.
For Target Relation, select Product.
For Target Product, search for the product that you want the discount to apply to, such as Ceramic Coffee Grinder.
For Target Quantity, specify the number products that can receive the discount during checkout. Since the discount is a buy-one, get-one, enter 1.
Scroll to the Coupon Source section, and specify the spec and spec value required for the target product discount to be valid.
For Source Relation, select SPEC.
For Source Spec, search for the required spec definition, such as Roast.
For Source Spec Value, enter the required spec value, such as Medium.
For Source Spec Minimum Quantity, specify the number of products with the required spec value that must exist in the cart before the discount is valid. Since the discount is a buy-one, get-one, enter 1.
Scroll back to the coupon details, and specify other coupon usage requirements.
For Max Use, enter the number of times that you want to allow the coupon to be used across all of your storefront's users.
For Total Used, enter 0.
For Minimum Quantity, optionally specify the number of products that must be in the shopping cart before a buyer can apply the coupon. If you don't care about enforcing a minimum quantity, leave this field blank.
Select a Storefront, select Enabled, and save.
